intro: Planotia acuminatissima, commonly known as the sharp-pointed fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that are typically divided into narrow, lance-shaped segments. The plant prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds in clusters called sori. Planotia acuminatissima is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
